newsitem.title: FRANCE: Paris-Instanbul 727-200F service could go daily.
newsitem.headline: Paris-Instanbul 727-200F service could go daily.

text.p: Turkish Airlines said its joint Boeing 727-200F feeder service with Air France, which operates between Istanbul and Paris/CDG, could move to a daily frequency later this year.

The service was launched in September 1996 with three weekly frequencies with the majority of cargo made up of textiles manufactured in Turkey destined for the U.S. market via Air France 's cargo network.

"From mid-December 1996 the feeder service was upgraded to five weekly frequencies as a result of strong demand and there is maybe scope during the forthcoming summer season (beginning end-March 1997) to operate on a daily basis. However, nothing has been finalised at this stage," a Paris-based Turkish Airlines official told Reuters.
The 727-200F's, which are part of Turkish Airlines' fleet, have a freight capacity of approximately 20 tonnes.
Air France and Turkish Airlines each operates twice daily passenger services between Paris and Istanbul. -- Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax+44 171 542 5017
